p: X-ray, CT, and MRI examinations were taken for all patients, and preoperative sagittal Cobb angle was measured on lateral X-ray. Regular anti-TB chemotherapy (rifampicin 450 mg/d, isoniazid 300 mg/d, pyrazinamide 1,500 mg/d, and ethambutol 750 mg/d) was applied for all patients for at least 2â€“4 weeks before surgery. Surgery was taken when TB poisoning symptoms were relieved, the ESR returned to normal or had a significant decrease and basic diseases such as diabetes, coronary heart disease, and hypertension were under control.
